intro: Eleocharis triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its triangular stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and shallow water areas. Its leaves are grass-like and usually have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Eleocharis triquetra plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
